description: Master CPA AUD covering Audit Procedures, Ethics, and Reporting

slides.title: Welcome to CPA AUD
slides.content:
# Auditing and Attestation (AUD)

AUD covers **audit standards** and **professional practices**.

## What You Will Learn

- **Ethics** - Professional standards
- **Engagement** - Planning and performance
- **Evidence** - Audit procedures
- **Reporting** - Opinions

## Exam Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Ethics & Independence | 15-25% |
| Risk Assessment | 25-35% |
| Evidence | 30-40% |
| Reporting | 10-20% |

slides.title: Professional Standards
slides.content:
# Ethics and Independence

## AICPA Code of Conduct

| Principle | Focus |
|-----------|-------|
| Responsibilities | Public interest |
| Public interest | Society |
| Integrity | Honest |
| Objectivity | Unbiased |
| Due care | Professional |
| Scope | Services |

## Independence

| Type | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| In fact | Actual |
| In appearance | Perceived |

## Threats and Safeguards

- Self-interest, familiarity, etc.

slides.title: Audit Planning
slides.content:
# Planning Phase

## Steps

```
1. Accept engagement
2. Gain understanding
3. Assess risks
4. Develop strategy
5. Prepare audit plan
```

## Understanding Entity

| Area | Methods |
|------|--------|
| Operations | Inquiry |
| Industry | Research |
| Internal control | Walkthrough |

## Materiality

```
Performance materiality < Overall materiality
```

slides.title: Risk Assessment
slides.content:
# Audit Risk Model

## Formula

```
Audit Risk = Inherent x Control x Detection

AR = IR x CR x DR
```

## Inherent Risk

- Nature of account
- Susceptibility to error

## Control Risk

- Effectiveness of controls

## Detection Risk

- Risk auditor fails to detect
- Controlled by auditor

| Component | Focus |
|-----------|-------|

| Information | Communication |

## Control Testing

| Test | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| Tests of controls | Effectiveness |
| Substantive | Amounts |

slides.title: Audit Evidence
slides.content:
# Gathering Evidence

## Characteristics

| Quality | Meaning |
|---------|--------|
| Sufficient | Quantity |
| Appropriate | Relevance + Reliability |

## Procedures

| Procedure | Purpose |
|-----------|--------|

| Inquiry | Questions |
| Confirmation | External |

| Reperformance | Redo |

slides.title: Sampling
slides.content:
# Audit Sampling

## Approaches

| Approach | Method |
|----------|--------|
| Statistical | Mathematical |
| Non-statistical | Judgment |

## Risks

| Risk | Effect |
|------|--------|
| Overreliance | Accept when shouldn't |
| Underreliance | Reject when shouldn't |
| Risk of incorrect acceptance | Substantive |
| Risk of incorrect rejection | Substantive |

## Sample Size Factors

- Tolerable deviation
- Expected deviation
- Confidence level

slides.title: Substantive Procedures
slides.content:
# Testing Balances

## Types

| Type | Focus |
|------|-------|
| Tests of details | Specific items |
| Analytical procedures | Relationships |

## Assertions

| Class | Examples |
|-------|----------|
| Transactions | Occurrence, completeness |
| Balances | Existence, valuation |
| Presentation | Rights, classification |

## Common Procedures

- Accounts receivable confirmations

slides.title: Completing the Audit
slides.content:
# Completion Phase

## Wrap-Up Procedures

| Procedure | Purpose |
|-----------|--------|
| Subsequent events | After year-end |
| Representation letter | Management |
| Attorney letter | Litigation |
| Going concern | Viability |

## Documentation

- Working papers
- Review process
- Retention (5+ years)

slides.title: Audit Reports
slides.content:
# Reporting Phase

## Opinion Types

| Opinion | When |
|---------|------|
| Unmodified | Fair presentation |
| Qualified | Except for |
| Adverse | Materially misstated |
| Disclaimer | Cannot opine |

## Report Elements

- Independent auditor's report
- Opinion paragraph
- Basis for opinion
- Management responsibility
- Auditor responsibility
- CAM (Critical Audit Matters)

slides.title: PCAOB Standards
slides.content:
# Public Company Audits

## Key Differences

| PCAOB | AICPA |
|-------|-------|
| SEC registrants | Private |
| ICFR opinion required | Optional |
| AS standards | AU-C |

## Integrated Audit

```
Financial statement audit
+ Internal control audit
= Integrated audit
```

## Inspections

- Regular PCAOB inspections
- Quality control
